Guinean Prime Minister on Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Guinean Prime Minister on Friendly Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- It is necessary to boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between Guinea and the DPRK as required by the new century and desired by the peoples of the two countries. Guinean Prime Minister Cellou Dalein Diallo said this on June 24 when meeting the DPRK government economic delegation led by Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man on a visit to Guinea upon the authorization of Guinean President Lansana Conte.
 The friendly and cooperative relations provided by President Kim Il Sung and the preceding presidents of Guinea have invariably grown strong and developed thanks to leader Kim Jong Il and President Lansana Conte, he said.    
 He said that the Guinean people express full support to the Korean people in their indomitable struggle for the sovereignty and peaceful reunification of the country.

NA Passage of "Agreement on Share of Defence Spending" Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
NA Passage of "Agreement on Share of Defence Spending" Opposed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification reportedly staged a one-by-one demonstration against the passage of the "agreement on the share of defence spending" through the south Korean "National Assembly" in front of its building on June 27, branding it as a product of submission to and collusion with the U.S. 
 Kong Tong Gil, chief of the team for disarmament and peace of the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, denounced the south Korean authorities for their disgraceful attitude such as offering the U.S. troops a huge amount of money collected from the people as taxes under the pretext of the south Korea-U.S. "alliance."    
 He strongly demanded the authorities immediately withdraw the "agreement on the share of defence spending," which would be helpful to the U.S. military presence in south Korea and its harsher colonial domination over it, and renegotiate the agreement.

DPRK Government Economic Delegation Comes Back
articles.content:
DPRK Government Economic Delegation Comes Back
    Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government economic delegation headed by Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man returned home today after winding up its visits to Uganda, Kenya, Guinea and Mali.
 The delegation also visited Yemen.
